notes: Separate note attached to Playbill detailing some casting changes.

performances.title: Policy: or, Thus Runs the World Away!

featuredAttractions.attraction: The Prologue to be spoken by Mr. I Wallack, The Epilogue by Mrs. Glover.

performers.roleNotes: with the Song of the Almanack Maker

performances.title: The Review. Or, The Wags of Windsor.

advertisements: The New Comedy, called Policy; or Thus Runs the World Away, having been received by an Elegant and overflowing Audience with the highest Approbation and Applause, will be repeated on every Evening till further Notice:-- The Nights of Mr. Kean's Performances excepted.
To-morrow, with the Comick Interlude of Blue Devils, and the Musical Farce of Matrimony.

On Thursday, Shakespeare's Tragedy of Othello, Iago, Mr. Kean, with (2d time this Season), the Grand Melo-dramatick Romance of Illusion; or The Trances of Nourjahad, which on Thursday last was revived with Renewed Splendour, and honoured with the usual Approbation.
On Friday, The New Comedy, with the Musical Interlude of The Purse; or The Benevolent Tar, and (4th time this season) the Last New and highly popular Melo-Drama.
On Saturday,, Mr. Kean will repeat the Character of Othello.

The numerous Applicants at the Box-Office are respectfully informed, that Mr. Kean will repeat the Character of Hamlet on Thursday, the 27th Instant, and that he will perform the Part of Shylock on Saturday, the 29th, The Tragedy of King Richard the Third every Monday till further Notice.
announcements: The Publick are respectfully apprized, that owing to the sudden Indisposition of Mrs. Orger, the Part of the Fidget, in the New Comedy, will be attempted by her Sister, and that Grace Gaylove, in the Farce, will be performed by Mrs. Harlowe.
